summary: The video features Vice President Kamala Harris addressing campaign staff at the Delaware headquarters after President Joe Biden announced he would not seek reelection and endorsed her. Harris emphasizes her intention to earn the Democratic nomination and win the presidency. President Biden joins the meeting via call, expressing gratitude to the staff and reiterating his commitment to continue working alongside Harris. Biden highlights the ongoing mission to protect democracy and combat threats posed by Donald Trump. Harris outlines her campaign goals, focusing on building the middle class, ensuring affordable healthcare, fair wages, and access to essential services like paid family leave and child care. She also addresses issues such as gun control and reproductive rights, emphasizing the importance of electing a Congress that supports women's autonomy.
keywords: Kamala Harris, Joe Biden, Democratic nomination, presidential campaign, Delaware headquarters, campaign staff, political remarks, COVID recovery, legislative work, Trump threat, reproductive rights, affordable healthcare, paid family leave, child care, gun control, abortion ban, middle class, election, November
